page.title: 07Langel Common
page.content: Langel Common is the sretch of land between the two branches of the river Windrush. The river separates Witney from Cogges. In ancient times Langel Common was called Witta's Island.The river branches here and almost joins up again soon after Langel Common. There used to be a forded crossing just up river from here .In ancient times anyone could graze his cattle on the common.In the future, Cogges will probably end up as part of Witney but now, on the Common, there is just a wild area. It is very unusual and very pleasant to have such a natural area so close to the centre of a town. The area is used by residents for walking and sometimes as a picnic area. Along the river banks are willow trees which have been pollarded. Wild flowers, shrubs and meadow grasses grow. There are wild swans and ducks on the river.
